Ethical use of materials: Thought about ethical use of materials

requirements: No prior experience needed: the course is made for beginners with no professional tools, who want a light, accessible craft. But professionals can just build on these instructions. There's a range of options, so you can fit the project to your abilities.
courses.description:
This course will provide you with instructions on how to prepare these Dream Sandals that will fit your own feet and taste. It's a fun and accessible craft that fits adults even if they have no prior experience in the crafting domain. You can make it from all-natural materials, and/or from all reused materials. You'll learn how to make the sandal, from start to finish, including options to choose from based on your taste and your abilities. You can come up with your own designs and have lots of fun while doing this.


As shown in the intro, there are 2 types of sandals. Choose which one you want to make. It's easier to work with thin leather, and it's easier to make the moccasin sandal. The sandwich sandal gives more protection. You can of course make both.


These sandals have minimalist soles, which are healthier for the foot and the whole body. They're thin and gentle, so they don't limit the feet's full range of movements and lets us feel the earth we walk on.


Hand-made shoes are a symbol of hand-made life.  How do you choose to walk on this earth? How thick is the layer you need between you and the earth? How are you made, what is your shape, and how does your rapping or support fit you?  Which colors and decorations accompany you? And how is your life manifested in the world?
target_audience: People curious about crafting, people who like walking barefoot

courses.description:
In this course, you will learn the basics of creating Rock, Punk, and Goth-inspired jewelry by combining dark, edgy elements with unique design techniques. You will start by exploring how to use metals, gemstones like onyx and spinel, and beads in the shapes of skulls, bats, and other iconic symbols to create a bold and rebellious aesthetic. We will cover the essential tools you need, such as wire cutters, pliers, and crimping tools, and demonstrate how to use them for tasks like bending, cutting, and attaching components.
You'll also learn how to incorporate chains, spikes, studs, and leather into your designs to enhance the rock, punk, and goth style. Additionally, you'll explore how to select and combine different materials to achieve the perfect balance of edgy and elegant, while also experimenting with color contrasts and textures to make your pieces stand out. Whether you aim to sell your creations or keep them for personal use, this course will guide you in producing statement jewelry pieces that embody the spirit of rock, punk, and goth fashion.
Humans have been adorning themselves with jewelry for thousands of years. There is something satisfying in creating your own jewelry designs. Hand-made, one-of-a-kind jewelry pieces are unique accessories that have a story to tell. This jewelry making course will show you how to make jewelry that is beautiful and practical so that you can sell it to make a profit or wear it yourself or give it as a gift to friends and family. In jewelry making, tools are used in a number of activities for holding and manipulating materials, including tasks such as cutting, bending, folding, attaching and finishing. When you start making handmade jewelry, you’ll need simple tools such as wire cutters or pliers. In the process of making a piece of jewelry, there are typically multiple steps that require specific tools. Pliers are the most commonly used tools to attach rings, fasteners, chains and as well as manipulate parts. Each tool has specific functions, so using the right one is very important. You must have the right tool for each step. You must connect and assemble all the individual components to create the finished jewelry piece. Rock, Punk and Goth Jewelry is not difficult to make. The dark look is given by gemstones like onyx or spinel, but also by beads with specific shapes, such as shapes like skulls, spiders or bats. So if you have prepared the tools, beads and accessories let’s begin making your first handmade items.
target_audience: People who like making beautiful handmade jewelry that they want to sell.
People who want to start a jewelry business and want to turn their hobby into a job.

requirements: Most important is the interest and passion to learn Aari Embroidery
You will need lot of patience
Make sure you have time to practice because without practice to learn aari embroidery is very difficult
Should have the basic materials to learn
Ofcourse proper lighting
courses.description: This course is for people who want to learn Aari or Maggam Work. It is also called Tambour Embroidery in a few parts of the world. Aari work is a type of embroidery work that is done by stretching the fabric tightly over a wooden frame. A pen-like needle, that resembles a crochet needle is used to do the intricate work. This is a type of embroidery where the working thread is fed from below the frame using our left hand. Chain stitch is the most important stitch in this embroidery and that is exactly what you will learn here. A design can be worked just by using chain stitch alone. This course has a very detailed explanation about how to work chain stitch which is just a basic of Aari Work. Once you know how to make the chain stitch, using the same technique can easily work with beads or related embellishments. So if you are in search of a course that could help you step up your skill then you are in the right place. I am sure this course will help you build a strong basic foundation for this new skill. Starting from the materials required to the techniques are very well explained. So if you practice with dedication then you are gonna rock !!
target_audience: People interested in Embroidery
People who are looking for a creative Hobby
Home makers who are interested to learn new art

courses.description:
Welcome to "The Art of Beading for Beginners," a comprehensive course designed to ignite your passion for beadwork and lead you on a journey of creativity, skill development, and artistic expression. Whether you're a beginner eager to learn the basics or just curious to understand some beading techniques, this course offers something for everyone.
Beading is not just a craft; it's a timeless art form that has captivated cultures across the globe for centuries. From ancient civilizations adorning themselves with intricate beadwork to contemporary artisans pushing the boundaries of design, the allure of beads transcends time and space. In this course, we will delve deep into the world of beads, exploring their significance, and endless possibilities for artistic creation.
Through hands-on demonstrations, step-by-step tutorials, and practical exercises, you will learn essential techniques such as stringing, weaving, and embellishing beads to create stunning jewelry and decorative pieces. Moreover, you'll gain insights into selecting the right materials, troubleshooting common problems, and unleashing your creativity to design unique beadwork.
Join us on this enriching journey as we unravel the secrets of beading and unleash your inner artist. Discover the joy of bringing beautiful beads to life and expressing yourself through this captivating art form.
By the end of this course, you will have the confidence to craft your own beaded jewelry, accessories, and decorative pieces with precision and creativity. Whether you want to create elegant bracelets, intricate necklaces, or stunning earrings, you will develop the skills needed to bring your artistic visions to life.
In addition to mastering fundamental techniques, you will also explore, pattern design, and finishing methods to enhance the quality and aesthetics of your beadwork. With each project, you'll refine your craftsmanship and unlock new creative possibilities, making beading a rewarding and enjoyable lifelong hobby.
target_audience: This course is designed for beginners with little to no experience in beadwork, as well as individuals interested in exploring the art form and developing their skills.

courses.description:
Embroidery is the craft of decorating fabric or other materials using a needle to apply thread or yarn. Embroidery effectively may also incorporate other materials such as pearls, beads, zardozi, mirrors and sequins.


It also include how to trace embroidery, transferring it on fabric, various stitches, beading, Zardozi & sequins work, and use of mirrors and learn how to stitch small fabric swatches on fabric.


Learning embroidery doesn't have to be difficult, and it definitely shouldn't feel like a huge investment of time and money. It is an easy and inexpensive hobby to jump into!
In this course, you will learn how to trace the design on  the fabric, placement of designs, to learn various  the types of stitches, how to sew mirror, sequins on the fabric, know the techniques of sewing zardozi, beads, know the art of ribbon work, how to make beautiful cutwork design on the  fabric.
Each topic is categorized to make the content easy to consume. Additionally, the various tips and examples have been given which makes the course more interesting. Explore and learn a variety of Hand Embroidery stitches and you’ll get the chance to learn all of the basic Hand Embroidery techniques as well, enabling you to design and create pieces to a high standard while developing your personal style and creativity.
Our accredited courses are recognized for their high standards of teaching and assessment.

Bring your fashion ideas to life and create a stunning portfolio that opens doors.
This Fashion Illustration Portfolio Building Course part 1 is designed for aspiring fashion designers, students, and creatives who want to develop their illustration skills and build a professional, eye-catching portfolio that reflects their unique style.
Through a step-by-step, hands-on approach, you’ll learn the core techniques of fashion sketching—from figure drawing and facial features to garment rendering and color theory. You’ll develop the ability to draw two fashion figures with proper proportions, create expressive faces, and illustrate clothing directly on the body with flow and accuracy. We’ll cover the fundamentals of movement, posture, and silhouette to help bring your designs to life on paper.
In addition, In part 2 that you can purchase after part 1 you’ll learn how to render a wide variety of textiles and surface details, including silk, lace, fur, leather, and beading—using techniques that give each fabric texture and depth. These skills are essential in making your illustrations look polished and industry-ready.
The course includes 6 structured classes, each focused on building essential skills and guiding you toward completing a cohesive portfolio. Students will also receive detailed notes and three professionally designed fashion figure templates to support their learning and speed up the sketching process.
Whether you're applying to fashion school, launching your career, or exploring your creative voice, this course will help you build a polished portfolio that showcases your talent and vision.
target_audience: This course is designed for anyone passionate about fashion and eager to bring their creative ideas to life through illustration. Whether you're a complete beginner or already have some experience, this course will guide you from the basics to advanced techniques in fashion drawing and design. It's especially valuable for: Aspiring fashion designers who want to visually express their design ideas. Students preparing to apply to fashion universities or colleges. Beginners who are curious about fashion illustration and want to build a strong foundation. Experienced designers looking to improve their sketching skills and expand their illustration techniques. Hobbyists and fashion enthusiasts who want to explore their creativity and learn how to draw fashion designs from imagination. No matter your starting point, if you’re interested in fashion and want to confidently draw any design that comes to mind, this course is for you.

objectives: how fabric wrinkles should be transferred to paper
fabric movements on the figure
form of fabrics according to body shapes
prismatic structure of fabrics
fabric toning
factors determining the form of fabrics
the factors that determine the direction of the fabrics
the light and shapes of the fabrics according to the structure of the body

LESSON VIDEO: 1 - GEOMETRIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF FABRICS
2 - GEOMETRIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF FABRICS PART 2
3 - GEOMETRIC INFRASTRUCTURE OF FABRICS PART 3
4 - VİDEO FLOWING DIRECTIONS OF THE FABRICS
5 - DRAWING TECHNIQUE OF STRESSED FABRICS 1st PART
6 - DRAWING TECHNIQUE OF STRESSED FABRICS PART 2
7 - DRAWING OF FABRIC HANGING FROM TWO CENTERS PART 1
8- DRAWING OF FABRIC HANGING FROM TWO CENTERS PART 2.
9 - DRAWING OF FABRIC HANGING FROM TWO CENTERS PART 3
10 - DRAWING FABRIC WRAPPING CYLINDRICAL FORM PART1
11- DRAWING FABRIC WRAPPING THE CYLINDRICAL FORM PART 2
12- DRAWING FABRIC WRAPPING THE CYLINDRICAL FORM PART 3

13 - TROUSERS DRAWING 2 .PART
16- Pants drawing Part 1
15 - SIDE TROUSERS DRAWING PART 2

18- DRAWING OF THE FABRIC WRINKLES ON THE ARM PART 2
19 - FINISH DETAILED FABRIC DRAWING PART 1
20 - FINISH DETAILED FABRIC DRAWING PART 2

requirements: paper
pencil
learning motivation
courses.description:
Hello there..
Fabrics appear with different purposes in every period of history. Sometimes in a designer dress,and sometimes as an object that completes the flow of paper in composition drawings. In this training, I explained fabric drawing from zero to advanced. From the prismatic substructure of fabrics I transferred everything from starting to advanced drawings. When you look at the fabrics, in what form should they go? What should be the direction of the wrinkles and the places where they should pile up? Overlapping.While finding answers to questions such as what are our priorities when determining the form of fabrics, you will also master the toning issues. You will also be able to have an idea about how to draw the clothes that stand naturally on the figure and make evaluations. You will also comprehend the subject of intonation according to the structure. You will be able to reflect the structure together with the shadow of light academically in compositions and still life drawings. Fabrics surrounding the cylindrical form you will understand how it should be and its features in the places where there is agglomeration. After describing the structure of the top and collapsed points linearly, you will see how we can express it with tone. In this way, you will be able to express the three-dimensional image, namely the concept of (volume). At the end of the course, you will be able to make academic drawings while mastering the concepts of fabric and wrinkles from every angle. In character and typography drawings, you will be able to describe the depressions and protrusions according to the direction of movement and flow, both with tone and linearly. Where you see the insides of the fabricsYou will be able to clearly feel its depth. Regarding toning, how do the fabrics shade each other according to the direction of the light? We will also see how they differ from each other. We will be able to analyze the different reactions given by the line value according to the light source. In addition, we will be able to create professional works by considering the tone and line value as a whole.
target_audience: anyone who wants to draw about it

courses.title: Celebrity Fashion Stylist: Fashion and Styling the Famous
courses.bio: Learn how to work as a Fashion Stylist to the stars
objectives: Learn the process of becoming a Stylist
Learn how Stylists select their assistants
Learn various terms used by stylist and in the fashion world
Learn the Business of working with clients and fashion stores
Learn how to acquire clothes for your clients and build your reputation
requirements: No prerequisites for this course
courses.description:
Becoming a tremendous stylist takes hard work, social skills, timing, persistence, knowledge, and fabulous resources for clients. This class will take you within the unique world of fashion and style. You will gain the techniques and skills you must have to start and sustain a career as a stylist upon completion of this course.
Industry Expert
Tiffany Dean Celebrity Fashion Stylist
Tiffany began her career as a Retail Merchandising Coordinator  for high-end fashion brands DKNY, BCBG, Max Azria, and Guess by Marciano.  She has quickly risen within the world of  celebrity fashion styling over the last decade with a roster of such clients as  Katy Perry, Lindsay Lohan, and Tyrese Gibson.   Also, she works with Emmy Award winning shows Modern Family and Hawaii 5.0,  as well as with many high fashion magazines such as Elle, Vogue, Marie Claire, Maxim, British FHM, and Bride and Bloom.
Featured Expert Angela Dean Celebrity Fashion Designer
Viewed as an industry pioneer by the fashion community, Angela  Dean has served as President of Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising  in Los Angeles, where the exhibit The Era of Entertainment was created to  preserve garments she made for Hollywood elite.
She has created looks that have been worn by an  extraordinary list of clients.  Among  them are Madonna, Halle Berry, Patti Labelle, Priscilla Presley, Monique, Mary  J. Blige, Magic Johnson, Paris Hilton, and Oprah Winfrey.  Her creations too have graced magazine covers,  awards shows, and CD covers such as,  the  30th Anniversary Essence magazine cover which represented the highest selling issue in the magazine’s history,   Natalie Cole’s gown worn on the cover of her  Grammy award winning album, Unforgettable, and numerous gowns for  actress Latonya Richardson’s Academy Awards appearances.
target_audience: Aspiring Stylist
Fashion Enthusiast
Those that want to better their own fashion knowledge
Vendors wanting to provide clothing for celebrities

courses.description:
Have you ever wanted to learn how to make braided friendship bracelets? Maybe you have always thought that you would love to give that a go! Well now you can, with my expert learn to make a boho friendship bracelet + anklets online workshop!


Did you know that the history of the friendship bracelet is over 2000 years old! Traditionally you would braid a friendship or 'wish' bracelet and send it to a friend who was going through a difficult time. We thought it would be perfect to create a bracelet making online workshop to help you learn something new, and gift forward your wishes to loved ones.


We are a family run business in the south west of England, with 40+ years experience in braiding! Teaching people how to create their own plastic free boho accessories is our passion!


Workshop includes...
-14 Step by step video tutorials
-Hints, tips and take aways for every stage
-How to braid candy stripes
-How to braid our famous 'Kiss Cross' pattern
-How to braid skinny stripes
-How to turn your bracelet into an anklet
-How to add fiddly beads and charms and lots lots more!
-BONUS: Printable hints and tips
-BONUS: Join our #WeAreSunSouls community
-BONUS: Quiz
-BONUS: Discount on any of our kits!


You will come away with the lifelong skill of how to make braided bracelets, and be able to always make and send thoughtful gifts to your loved ones.


If you have any questions please reach out to Bridie via instagram @wearesunsouls
target_audience: Crafters
Jewellery makers
Children aged 6+
Creatives
Family activity
Party activity

courses.title: One Stroke nail art level 2
courses.bio: One Stroke level 2 nail art course for nail professionals
objectives: One of the key things students will learn is color blending.
Students will learn how to use the One Stroke brush to create a variety of effects.
A third skill students will acquire is composition and design placement.
Lastly, students will gain expertise in painting realistic flowers and petals using the One Stroke method.
requirements: Basic knowledge of the One Stroke technique is recommended to take the course, but many beginners have successfully completed it with great results.
courses.description:
Are you ready to take your One Stroke painting skills to the next level? This Level 2 online course is designed for anyone who wants to refine their technique, create more intricate designs, and master advanced painting methods. Whether you're a beginner or someone who already has a basic understanding of the One Stroke technique, this course will guide you step by step through new challenges and help you unlock your full artistic potential.
With over 10 years of experience in the nail art industry and an academic background in visual communication education, I am uniquely qualified to teach you the finer details of One Stroke painting. My approach combines professional expertise with a passion for teaching, offering clear, easy-to-follow instructions that cater to all learning styles. You’ll gain the confidence and skills to create stunning floral designs, understand the importance of color blending, and master brush control for precise and beautiful results.
This course goes beyond technique—I'll also share essential tips on composition, material selection, and design placement, ensuring you can create artwork that is not only technically flawless but also visually captivating. If you're passionate about painting and eager to improve your skills, this is the perfect course for you. Join me, and let's make your artistic dreams a reality!
target_audience: The course is designed for individuals who are interested in advancing their One Stroke painting skills, from hobbyists to more experienced artists. It is ideal for those who have a basic understanding of the technique and want to refine their abilities, but beginners are also welcome as the course has been successfully completed by many starting out with One Stroke painting. Whether you're looking to improve your technique, explore new design ideas, or take your artwork to a more professional level, this course provides valuable instruction for all skill levels.

courses.title: Simple Polymer Clay Techniques for Jewelry Making
courses.bio: Start Your Own Jewelry Business
objectives: How to make DIY clay jewelry items using polymer clay
What the clay modelling tools are and how to use them
How to combine the colors for jewelry making
Understand the basic techniques of working with polymer clay
Introduce a range of clay working techniques
Develop skills for assembling finished polymer clay pieces with jump rings, clasps, and other jewelry findings.
Master the creation of unique earrings, necklaces, and bracelets from polymer clay.
Understand how to blend colors and use gradients to create eye-catching jewelry designs.

Polymer Clay Tools and How to Use the Cl: Polymer Clay Tools and How to Use the Clay
Using The Mokume Gane Technique to Make: Using The Mokume Gane Technique to Make Jewelry Sets
Using The Marbling Technique to Make a P: Using The Marbling Technique to Make a Pendant
Using the Scrap Clay to Make Jewelry: Making a Pendant with Scrap Clay
How to Sell Polymer Clay Jewelry, Buildi: How to Sell Polymer Clay Jewelry, Building Your Jewelry Business

requirements: no experience is necessary
the course will provide all the necessary information
courses.description:
In this course, I will show you a few techniques for creating polymer clay jewelry. The best part about clay is that you can literally create any shape and style of jewelry you want. With clay, there are very few limitations. Working with clay is fun and relaxing. You will also need to know how to combine colors for your jewelry items. For this purpose, you can use the Color Wheel, which indicates the right color combinations. If you do not know what colors to go with then just stick with the primaries, along with black and white. You can always mix your own colors. If you are unsure about the use of colors, then think about the basic color theory. You will also need some tools and findings, in order to connect the different parts of your jewelry. You can actually find a lot of these tools in your kitchen, so it's not necessary to spend a lot of money before you even start working. It is advisable to have your own working space, where you can keep all the things you need to create your jewelry items. It does not have to be anything special or expensive, but it is good to have a table where you can place all your tools and materials so that you don’t need to put it all away each time you're finished with work.
In this course, you will also learn how to manipulate polymer clay to create different textures, shapes, and designs for your jewelry pieces. The beauty of polymer clay lies in its versatility — from beads to pendants and earrings, you can craft anything that suits your personal style. I will guide you through the process of rolling, shaping, and baking your clay creations, ensuring that they maintain durability and a professional finish. Whether you're making statement pieces or delicate accessories, you'll gain the skills needed to bring your jewelry ideas to life.
You'll learn about the different types of polymer clay, the best techniques for blending colors, and how to use tools like cutters, molds, and rolling pins. Additionally, you'll discover how to assemble your jewelry using jump rings, clasps, and other findings, allowing you to create complete and functional pieces.
By the end of this course, you'll not only be equipped with the basic polymer clay skills needed for jewelry-making, but you'll also be ready to start creating unique pieces that reflect your personal style. Whether you're making jewelry for yourself or planning to sell your creations, this course will give you the confidence and tools to succeed.
target_audience: People who want to learn how to create DIY jewelry items using polymer clay
People who want to make their own clay jewelry items that they can use themselves or sell in their jewelry store

courses.description:
Hello welcome to this course, in this course you will learn how to sew without a sewing machine, anyone can do it completely narrated by me easy process to go along , along with basic sewing, doing patch work, and sewing button, how to fix thread coming our of fabric
We’re starting right from the beginning, so don’t worry if you’ve never sewn before. And if you’ve been sewing for a while, but without much guidance or without a strong technical focus, I'm sure you’ll notice your skills and your finished projects improve significantly.
You done need any experience to get started with it.
This course is focused on sewing without the sewing machine efficiently, you don't need a sewing machine to sew efficiently, if you have a one that's okay but if you don't have than this course will help you in sewing it without it, making it easy to learn to sew.


What am I going to get from this course
1) learn sewing basics
2) what are essential materials required
3) how to cut the fabric
4) how to use threads
5) how to use fabric for sewing
6) complete materials required section in detail
7) how to sew buttons on fabric
8) how to do patch work
9) how to do make 2 different types
10) how to join the 2 ends of cloth together
11) How to fix threads coming out from fabric
12) tips and tricks to how to sew efficiently
13) how to fold the fabric for sewing
14) how to use a needle holder and how to make it
15) and many more

courses.title: Potenc.IA | Criatividade com IA
courses.bio: Aprenda a usar a IA como aliada para criar com estratégia e originalidade.
objectives: Aplicar inteligência artificial como aliada no processo criativo de forma prática e consciente.
Desenvolver projetos visuais e campanhas com o suporte de IA, mantendo identidade e originalidade.
Utilizar ferramentas como Midjourney, ChatGPT, Runway e outras para ampliar suas ideias e entregas.
Criar, testar e aprimorar ideias criativas com agilidade, explorando novas linguagens visuais e narrativas.

Introdução aos Prompts e Tokens: Prompts e Tokens: Como a IA entende você
Criação Visual com IA na Prática: Gerando e Tratando Imagens com IA
Finalização e Apresentação: Apresentando com Impacto usando o PREZI IA
Movimento e Narrativa com IA: Transformando Imagens em Vídeos com KLING IA

requirements: Não é necessário ter experiência com IA ou criatividade. Basta ter curiosidade e vontade de explorar novas formas de criar.
courses.description:
Desperte sua criatividade com Inteligência Artificial
O Potenc.IA é um curso prático e direto ao ponto para criativos que querem explorar o poder da inteligência artificial sem perder a originalidade.
Aqui, você vai aprender como usar ferramentas como ChatGPT, Firefly, Visual Electric, READ IA, PREZI e KLING IA para criar ideias, desenvolver projetos visuais, apresentar com impacto e até transformar imagens em vídeos incríveis e profissionais.
Mais do que dominar ferramentas, você vai entender como pensar criativamente com IA, construir briefings estratégicos, criar com propósito e monetizar suas habilidades no mercado real.
Seja você designer, publicitário, artista, freelancer ou apenas alguém curioso por esse novo universo, o Potenc.IA foi feito para potencializar o que só você tem: sua visão criativa.
Você vai sair do curso com uma nova forma de pensar, criar e apresentar ideias.
Vai entender como a IA pode ser aliada estética, técnica e estratégica em seus projetos criativos e profissionais.
E, acima de tudo, vai aprender a usar esse conhecimento de forma prática, com ferramentas acessíveis, em qualquer estágio da sua jornada criativa.
Não é um curso sobre tecnologia. É sobre você criar com mais intenção, impacto, autenticidade, propósito, liberdade, profundidade e visão de futuro.
target_audience: Criativos, designers, publicitários, artistas visuais e profissionais de comunicação que querem usar a IA para ampliar seu repertório, criar com mais fluidez e se destacar no mercado.

satın alabilirsiniz bu kursta 29 yıllık mesleki bilgilerimi sizlerle paylaşacağım 500 den fazla kişiye birebir özel ders verdim bu kişilerin yüzde 80 ni moda tasarım mezunu ve giyim ögretmeniydi şaşıracagınızı biliyorum ama bu işin okulunu okumayan kişiler daha çabuk ve hızlı ögreniyordu bunun sebebi  gerçek hayatla okuldaki bilgiler asla örtüşmüyordu moda tasarım mezunları gögüsle bel hattını birleştirdigimde 12 ile 14 birleştirmiyormuyuz demeleriydi işlem basamaklarını ezberlemek çok tehlikelidir neyi neden niçin yaptıgını bilmek çok önemlidir dünya genelinde yapılan araştırmalara göre sanatsal faliyetlerde dogaçlama yapanların yüzde 99 başarılı olmuştur akademik teknik bigilerlerle çalışıp kutunun içinde kalanların sadeceyüzde 1 başarılı olmuştur  sloganımız moda dogaçlamadır işlem basamaklarıyla degil neyi neden niçin yaptığımı anlatacağım çizerken neyi neden niçin yaptığınızı bileceksiniz mükemmellik sürekli bir şeyler ekleyerek değil bir şeyler çıkartarak gerçekleşir yüzlerce özel ders verdim  kişiye özel birebir öğrencilerden hiç moda ile alakası olmayanlar çok daha çabuk öğreniyordu sebebi kafasında  zihnindeki kirli bilgiler olmamasıydı malesef moda tasarım mezunları çok daha gec öğreniyordu en büyük yanlışları işlem basamaklarını ezberlemeleriydi pratik yollarını anlatırken hocam 1 ile 12'yi birleştirmiyormuyduk demeleriydi neden niçin birleştiriyorsun dediğimde donup kalmalarıydı işlem basamaklarını ezberlemek çok tehlikeli  bir işi yaparken neyi neden niçin yaptınız sorgulamalısınız dünya genelindeki araştırmalara göre moda sektöründe başarılı olanların yüzde 93 ü altyapıdan çıraklıktan yetişmiştir bu istatistik sizin yapamayacağınız anlamına gelmez mükemmellik sürekli bilgi ekleyerek degil Zihni temizleyerek gerçekleşir bir heykeltıraşın courses.description:
Se studiază individual pe baza filmulețelor proiectarea tiparelor de bază (se învață a costrui șabloane după marimi individuale pentru toate tipurile de produse vestimentare) .
Se indică toți pașii de prelucrare a fiecărui produs în parte. Pentru partea practică ai nevoie de : masină de cusut, croiul, materiale potrivite si toate detaliile vestimentare.

Curs Crearea propriului brand vestimentar

Cursul care te învață să exprimi exact cine ești prin Haine.
Desfășurat în 8 săptămâni, acest curs, vei învăța care sunt principiile de creare a unui brand
vestimentar, istoria fashion industriei din Franța în Moldova, tendințele fashion locale și
internaționale, studii de caz ale brandurilor de succes și pașii pe care trebuie să-i faci ca să
construiești un Brand vestimentar.

Curs de croitorie și design vestimentar

Un curs în loc de două pentru suflete arzătoare de dorință. Acest curs îmbină două dintre cursurile Couturier Academy: croitorie și design vestimentar. Dacă nu ai timp suficient, dar vise și dorințe nelimitate, poți parcurge etapele de crearea vestimentară mai rapid: de la design, tipare la croit și țesut în doar 10 zile alături de Couturier Academy

Curs Crearea propriului brand vestimentar

Cursul care te învață să exprimi exact cine ești prin Haine.
Desfășurat în 8 săptămâni, acest curs, vei învăța care sunt principiile de creare a unui brand
vestimentar, istoria fashion industriei din Franța în Moldova, tendințele fashion locale și
internaționale, studii de caz ale brandurilor de succes și pașii pe care trebuie să-i faci ca să
construiești un Brand vestimentar.

Curs de proiectare a tiparelor de bază și modelarea constructivă
Un curs atunci când știi ce îți dorești să vezi pe tine, dar nu știi de unde pornești.
Dacă știi formele pe care vrei să le îmbraci, la acest curs, vei învăța cum le obții
cu exactitate: simetria liniilor, proiectarea tiparelor de bază, tipurile de stofă și
modelare constructivă pentru diferite mărimi.



Curs de croitorie – vestimentație de damă

De la teorie la practică, cursul în care devii artist.
Cursul de croitorie te învață cum să îți transformi visele și aspirațiile din domeniul
vestimentației în realitate: vei învăța măiestria de a mânui o mașină de cusut, a
croi și a călca fiecare linie a țesăturii până la perfecțiune.
target_audience: Pasionatii si persoanele dornice de a invata arta design-ului vestimentar.

courses.description:
Merhaba
Moda aksesuar tasarımı eğitimine hoşgeldiniz.
Moda aksesuarı kıyafeti tamamlamak için kullanılan ve genel olarak görünümü tamamlayan bir stil ifadesidir. Peki moda aksesuarları nelerdir? Moda aksesuarı deyince; ayakkabı, takı, kemer,eşarp, şapka ve çanta gibi moda ürünleri akla gelir.
Peki bu eğitimde moda aksesuarı olarak neler öğreneceğiz bakalım, Ayakkabı türlerini tanıyarak başlayacağımız eğitimde ilk olarak elin oran ve orantısını karakalem çizerek öğrenelim ardından ayakkabı tasarımına geçmeden önce ayak anatomisi çizimi, ardından 3 farklı ayakkabı modelinin çizim ve tasarımını yapacağız, ilk uygulamada platformlu bayan ayakkabı modelini, tüm detaylarıyla çizerek sunuma hazırlayalım, ardından kelebek detaylı bir ayakkabı tasarımını eskizden renkli illüstrasyon çalışmasına adım adım uygulayacağız ve ve son olarak babet model bir ayakkabı tasarımını malzemelerinden eskizine ve teknik pafta üzerinde teknik çizimine kadar uygulayalım.
Ardından çanta tasarımına geçelim ve ahşap saplı bir çanta tasarımını eskizden tasarıma adım adım uygulayalım.
Bu bölümü tamamladıktan sonra Adobe Illustrator ve photoshop programlarını baştan sonra adım adım uygulamaları yaparak öğrendikten sonra
Adobe ıllustrator programında baştan sona topuklu ayakkabı illüstrasyonu çizim uygulaması yapalım.
3d studio max ile 3 boyutlu tasarıma giriş yapalım , Materyal atama ve realistik render tekniklerini öğrendikten sonra 3 d max ile babet ayakkabıyı baştan sona modelleyelim.
Son olarak da 3d studio max programında artistik bir şapkayı tasarlayıp. böylece moda aksesuar tasarımı eğitimini tamamlayalım.
Hazırsan başlayalım.

Draw With Me!: Dress Up Lolita Part 3

courses.description:
Anime Academy: Anime Outfits 101 is your go-to for designing your own anime outfits for illustrations or even for your own personal stories. This course will take you from having little knowledge about style and clothes, to creating good design and understanding the basics of how clothes work.
So what else is in it for you?


You’ll be designing 3 main projects in this course that will take you from just drawing basic clothes to creating your own outfit!
You’ll gain access to all 11 sections of the course. There are also 90 downloadable resources for you to use to help you with this course.
This course is set up to help you step by step with understanding the basics of clothes and style. It will help with creating interesting designs for characters that you want to create, as outfit design connects a lot with how the character’s personality is.


Don’t believe me? I offer you a full money back guarantee within the first 30 days of purchasing the course.


Here’s what’s in it for you:
You’ll get access to the 11 sections of the course that will teach you the fundamentals of drawing clothes and using that knowledge to design. The course has over 10 hours of content that I will walk you through each step of the way.
Here is what to expect in this course:
* The course starts with the basics. I will be teaching you the basics about drawing shirts, dresses, skirts and pants. You will also learn how to color them in a simple way. When coloring, you can also put these basic clothes together to make a simple outfit. I will also be teaching you how to draw the main template before starting.
* Next, after learning the basic clothes, you will learn how to draw accessories from simple to complex to go along with your outfit.
* Once you've learned basic clothes and accessories, you will learn how to draw different types of shoes ranging from sneakers to formal shoes.
* Then you are going to learn how to draw simple clothes in different views and in motion. In this section you will learn how cloth moves and flows, as well as the direction it is going in.
* From then, you will move onto the basics of style ranging from casual, formal, and Lolita style. This will help you on how to study what different styles look like and how you can execute them onto your design. You will also learn how to collect reference for your 3 main projects.
* And finally, for the next couple courses, you will start working on the 3 main projects: designing 3 types of casual, formal, and Lolita. This will take you from just drawing basic clothes to actually designing how your outfits will look. I will be walking through with the whole design process from reference gathering to showing you how to use it, as well as finalizing the colors.


Over the course of these 9 sections you will learn:
* How to draw shirts, dresses, pants, skirts
* How to draw a multitude of accessories
* Drawing different types of shoes
* Drawing clothes in different angles
* How to color clothes, shoes, accessories
* How to analyze style and use it in your design
* The importance of reference gathering
* How to use references to design an outfit
* How to design 3 types of casual outfits
* How to design 3 types of formal outfits
* How to design 2 types of Lolita outfits




What else will you get?
- Lifetime access to course materials
- Understanding how to create a unique outfit for character design
- Tutorial sheets as downloadable resources for each lecture
This all comes under one convenient easy to use platform. Plus you will get fast, friendly, responsive support on the Udemy Q&A section of the course or direct message.


So what are you waiting for? Sign up now and start creating your anime outfits!
target_audience: Beginner and intermediate artists wanting to draw outfits for their characters

courses.title: Making Handmade Jewelry for Your Pet

requirements: No jewelry making experience is needed. The course will give all the necessary information on jewelry making.
The course will provide information regarding the tools and findings that the future jewelry creator will need to buy if he intends to make handmade jewelry.
courses.description: You love creating your own jewelry? When you wear beautiful handmade jewelry, it is a pleasure to be able to explain to your friends the actual story behind what you are wearing. An artisan’s personal connection and love of their craft can transform ordinary objects into jewelry masterpieces. Each artist has a unique reason for designing jewelry. Your design is sending a message. Maybe only you know the true meaning behind that piece of jewelry. Then why not learn how to make beautiful collars for your dog or cat, too? Your dog or cat can become the inspiration for your business. If you love working with quality material and often get lost for hours in jewelry supply shops whilst hunting for your next design, then creating handmade jewelry is the thing you should do. If your pet is lively, curious and independent, you surely love him very much and want him to be happy at all times. Then why not spoil your little friend with the most beautiful collars, that you created especially for your beloved pet. You can make beautiful, high quality, comfortable and affordable handmade dog collars which are borne entirely from your love for your dog or your cat.
target_audience: People who want to spoil their pets with handmade jewelry
People who want to start a jewelry business and want to turn their hobby into a job.

courses.description:
This course is a practical explanation about how to develop block patterns for children's frock styles. Kids wear is the next level after one learns elementary pattern making and tailoring. Once you complete the course you will have a fair understanding of children's body measurements for different age groups. You will develop the skill of applying simple flat pattern methods and pattern alteration techniques to create a variety of frock styles.
Kids wear form the foundation for learning pattern development and garment construction. Typically adult's clothing is a replica of kids wear or vice versa. Kids wear pattern development is much more simpler as their bodies do not have complex curves and contours or bulges. Anybody who can learn kids wear apparel production can easily adapt himself or herself into a good pattern master eventually and one who is able to create patterns for adult's clothing as well.
The course begins with an introductory presentation about the course content followed by a practical demonstration for drawing foundation garment patterns for kids wear. Pattern adaptation methods are demonstrated to convert these basic garment templates into a variety of styles to construct girls wear clothing like the classic A-Line frock, waistline frock with a flared skirt, hipline frock with a gathered skirt. Anybody who has basic knowledge of sewing can learn to design and develop few classic frock designs from this course.
Pattern making is not just science or mathematics but it is creativity as well. The visual appeal of a garment depends on the choice of garment silhouette, drape, cut and structure. Factors like fabric, colors, prints, trims and finishes matter a lot while developing a design. A sheer fabric creates a flat effect in a gathered skirt but yet it has a soft, feminine and flowy appearance. A denim or gaberdine gives a stiff, casual and tough-to-tear kind of a look to a frock. Satins, velvets, organza's and lace fabrics give a dressy look to a frock. On must give a thought to features like pleats, gathers, flare, canvasing etc. while choosing a fabric or a fabric design or texture.

Jeder hat sein Lieblingskleidungsstück, eine Hose, die perfekt sitzt, ein Oberteil wie eine zweite Haut, was ist eures?
Wie können wir diese Kleidungsstücke kopieren, ohne sie in Stücke zu schneiden?
Wie können dies tun!
Dieser Kurs ist für alle Niveaus geeignet, Ihr  braucht keine Vorkenntnisse.
Natürlich solltet Ihr ein bisschen nähen können, nach dem Abpausen des Schnittes  bekommt Ihr euer Schnittmuster und schliessendlich  müsst Ihr es  dann nähen.
ihr  werdet mit dem Ergebnis zufrieden sein.
Zum Kopieren des Schnittes benötigt Ihr  nur wenige Hilfsmittel: Nessel, Stecknadeln, Bleistift, Lineal, Maßband und die Stoffschere.
In diesem Kurs zeige ich euch, wie ihr  das Abrubbeln macht: Kopieren des Schnittmusters und dann ein neues Stück anfertigen.Ich zeige euch  Schritt für Schritt, wie ihr  das Schnittmuster kopiert.Dann könnt ihr euer  bestes Stück nähen!
Ich zeige in diesem Kurs, wie man eine Hose (asymmetrisch) kopiert.
Ihr  werdet  sehen, wir die Hose kopiert: die beiden Vorderteile, das Rückenteil und den Bund.
In diesem Video lernt Ihr auch, wie man Falten, Abnäher, aufgesetzte Taschen und Taschen allgemein kopiert. Dann werdet ihr in der Lage sein, jedes Kleidungsstück zu kopieren.
Nach diesem Kurs werdet ihr  in der Lage sein, ein  neues Lieblingskleidungsstück zu erstellen, in Zukunft werdet ihr  nur noch Lieblingskleidungsstücke in eurem Kleiderschrank haben!
Sucht ein  geliebtes Stück aus und los geht's mit dem Kurs!

courses.description:
Welcome to our SIMPLE STEPS Educational Learning System.


This Dartless Trouser PATTERN Block Course is the 1st course in our Pattern Making and Sewing Course Series.


Our Courses are:
Very Straight forward to follow.
There is no waffling on.
We provide very simple layouts.
Stress Free


We breakdown complex learning for you into very easy, understandable steps.


In this beginners course you will learn how to:


1. Accurately DRAFT a Dartless Trouser Block
2. Accurately CUT place and Cut the pattern on the Fabric
4. How to Use a Sewing Machine
3. How to SEW the Dartless Trouser PATTERN prototype


This pattern making course is created for students who like to learn in a systematic orderly and professional way with simple formulas they can apply to any body shape or size.
Also include is the basic sewing skills that will help you SEW your pattern prototype to check the fitting for accuracy.
At the end of the Course you will learn how to Create, Cut and Sew Dartless Trouser Pattern accurately and professionally.


First of all WHAT IS PATTERN MAKING?
Pattern making also called pattern cutting or pattern drafting is the process of designing garment patterns for a fashion drawing.


A pattern is a term in sewing and fashion design that is referred to the paper or cardboard template from which the parts of a garment are traced onto fabric before cutting out and assembling the fabrics int a garment.

A custom-fitted basic pattern is a premade template from which patterns for many different styles can be created. It is called a sloper for home sewer or a block for industrial production.


The flat-pattern method begins with the creation of a sloper or block, a basic pattern made from body measurements.


The pattern block or sloper is usually made of lightweight cardboard or tagboard, without seam allowances or style details. Pattern or sloper shape can be further refined form its original look by making a series of mock-up garments with a less expensive fabric called toile or muslins.


The final block or sloper can be used to create patterns for many styles of garments with varying necklines, sleeves, dart designs and garment shapes.
Now, that we know basically what pattern making is, WHAT IS THE ROLE OF A PATTERN MAKER?

A pattern maker creates a prototype, similar to an actual garment design to be made. They test the prototype pattern to be made by using a less expensive fabric called the muslin or toile.


Muslin fabrics are inexpensive fabrics that are easy to work with when making garment prototypes.


The prototype garment made from the pattern can be adjusted by pinning the fabric around the body or a dress form.


The sewer cuts the patterns on the muslin using the same method that they will use for the actual garment, according to a pattern. The muslin pieces are then fit together and other adjustments are made.


This provides the sewer with pre-made shapes to use as a guideline for marking out the pattern pieces and cutting the fabric for the finished garment.


At the end of the Course you will learn how to Create, Cut and Sew Dartless Trouser Pattern prototype (mockup) accurately and professionally using the muslin test fabric.
target_audience: This DARTLESS Trouser PATTERN BLOCK construction and SEWING course is for a complete BEGINNER who want to learn professional steps in creating the Basic DARTLESS Trouser PATTERN BLOCK construction and prototype (mockup) SEWING in simple steps.

The module will take a step-by-step approach to ensure that learners will understand each step in the process. Initially, learners will be introduced to fabric recommendations and basic sewing tools suitable for an A-line skirt. Learners will learn how to take their own measurements (or the measurements of others) before proceeding to create a basic block pattern of an A-line skirt. Using this pattern, learners will then be taught how to fully draft the skirt and ultimately sew it.


In this module, you will be learning:
1. Choosing the right fabric for an A-line Skirt.
2. Learn about the types and uses of various sewing tools.
3. How to take Body Measurements.

If you really love working with clay, you like sculpting, especially very small things, you will love to use your imagination to create bracelets, earrings or necklaces. Air dry clay has the texture of stiff bread dough therefore it is easy to mold right out of the package. It does, however begin to dry a bit almost right away, so you should make sure you keep moving with it or you will find you have to knead it. If after a few hours you want to make some changes to it, the clay is still a little workable. No one wants plain jewelry. Air dry clay allows you to create complicated structures, combine colors and use your imagination. The DIY air dry clay jewelry is so much fun to make. You’ll want to wear it every day. And the air dry clay handmade jewelry will also be so special because they are handmade by you. Everyone loves unique and handmade gifts. Beside that, they are also very inexpensive. And while the drying time takes the longest part of your project, you will be surprised at how many dozens of items you can create easily in a couple of hours. You will be creating treasured pieces of jewelry that will last for years to come.
target_audience: People who want to learn how to create air dry clay jewelry and start their own jewelry business

Fazendo suas modelagens diretamente no computador, você terá muito mais agilidade e precisão no processo de criar as modelagens, pois praticamento toda modelagem inicia com um retângulo, então quanto tempo você leva para fazer este retângulo no papel com esquadro e lápis? E quanto tempo você leva para fazer o mesmo retângulo no computador?
Para uma modelagem perfeita você precisa ter o máximo de precisão nas medidas. Você acha que consegue mais facilmente isso na modelagem manual ou na computadorizada?
Qual espaço físico você precisa para arquivar suas modelagens manuais? A modelagem computadorizada além de ocupar espaço zero em pastas ou gavetas, você pode ter suas bases salvas, fazer as interpretações e imprimir somente o que precisar.
Fazendo suas modelagens no computador, você poderá abrir o arquivo em qualquer outro programa específico de modelagem de roupas, sem falar que se quiser trabalhar em alguma empresa como modelista você já terá este conhecimento.
E se você tem um negócio também poderá ainda lucrar com as modelagens que criar e vendê-las pela internet para qualquer pessoa poder imprimir, pois são salvas em arquivo pdf.
Neste curso você irá aprender de uma forma fácil e com um passo a passo muito prático, a fazer as bases de modelagens:
•Saia
•Blusa
•Calça
Através destas bases você cria qualquer modelo de roupa feminina!

courses.description:
Welcome to Upscale Patterns: Beginner's Guide to Patternmaking Basics! This course is your first step into the world of fashion design, thoughtfully crafted for aspiring designers, sewing enthusiasts, and complete beginners eager to unlock the power of custom patternmaking.
Patternmaking is the foundation of every well-constructed garment. In this course, you'll be introduced to the essential tools, terminology, and techniques used by fashion professionals to draft accurate, well-fitting patterns. You’ll learn how to create and use basic slopers—custom-fit templates that form the base of any garment design.
Through step-by-step lessons, you’ll gain a clear understanding of how slopers are developed, how to read and transfer reference points like darts, waistlines, and seam allowances, and how to transform a flat draft into a wearable piece. Each module is designed to break down complex concepts into easy-to-follow instructions, helping you build confidence with every step.
By the end of the course, you’ll have the knowledge and skills to start developing a personalized library of slopers—or “blocks”—that serve as the blueprint for countless custom designs. Whether your goal is to launch your own clothing line or create better-fitting garments at home, this course will give you the foundational knowledge to bring your vision to life.
target_audience: Ideal for aspiring fashion designers and sewists eager to learn pattern making, this course introduces the basic principles to help you begin bringing your design ideas to life.

courses.description:
Welcome to "Clasps, Crimps, and Cord Ends: Handmade Bracelets Findings," a comprehensive course designed to help you explore the art of jewelry-making. Whether you’re new to the craft or looking to improve your skills, this course will provide you with the essential techniques to create beautiful, high-quality handmade bracelets. Through a combination of theory and practical application, you'll gain the confidence to bring your jewelry creations to life.
In this course, you'll begin by understanding the different types of findings used in bracelet-making, from clasps and crimps to cord ends and jump rings. We will explore how each component plays a vital role in crafting durable and elegant pieces. You’ll also learn how to properly measure and size your bracelet projects to ensure a perfect fit.
The hands-on portion of the course will guide you through step-by-step bracelet creation, using a variety of materials. As you work on different designs, you’ll gain the skills needed to create your unique pieces that match your style.
By the end of the course, you'll not only have mastered bracelet-making techniques but also be equipped to design and create other jewelry items, such as anklets. You will be prepared to take your creativity further, whether as a hobby or by turning your passion into a small business.
You'll gain valuable insights into the tools and materials used in bracelet-making, learning how to choose the best options for your projects. From selecting the right findings to mastering the techniques that ensure your designs last, every detail is covered to give you the foundation you need to succeed.
Whether you're crafting for yourself, creating personalized gifts, or exploring the possibility of selling your designs, this course will empower you to turn your jewelry-making ideas into reality. The creative potential is endless as you experiment with different materials, styles, and techniques.
target_audience: People who want to learn how to create beautiful handmade bracelets

Side Dart Bodice Block:
The Side Dart Bodice Block is the foundation that can be used for Corsets and Bustier, amongst other garments.

The techniques are easy to follow and replicate for the SHOULDER DART BODICE BLOCK.

Following these steps to make your Bodice Pattern Blocks, will give you the confidence to try to explore the Pattern Making on your own.


The learning process in this course has been made as detailed and simple as possible.

Everything you want to know about fashion design is at Start Now Fashion. Start your perfect design training now, from illustration to technical drawing, from intonation to collection design! courses.title: Pattern Making - Basic Bodice

requirements: No Experience Needed
courses.description:
This course equips you with essential pattern-making skills, covering tools, measurement techniques, grain lines, and bodice drafting to help you create accurate, well-fitted garment patterns for various designs.

• Course Overview: This introductory course on pattern making will provide a solid foundation for transforming fashion ideas into accurate, well-fitted garments. You’ll learn essential techniques for creating and refining garment patterns.
• Tool Mastery: Explore the necessary tools for pattern making, including rulers, French curves, and measuring tapes, understanding their unique functions and importance in creating precise patterns.
• Precision Measuring: Develop skills in taking accurate measurements on a mannequin, ensuring every pattern is tailored to fit flawlessly.
• Grain Line Fundamentals: Learn about grain lines and how fabric alignment impacts garment fit and drape, a crucial factor in professional pattern making.
• Bodice Drafting: Draft a basic bodice, covering key techniques such as shaping, dart placement, and measurements to create a foundational garment piece.
• Recap and Refinement: Finish your bodice pattern, applying final touches and reinforcing the core skills learned throughout the course.
• Course Outcome: By the end, you’ll be equipped with the tools, techniques, and confidence to build on your pattern-making skills, setting the stage for more advanced garment construction and creative design exploration.
target_audience: Fashion Beginners
Pattern Making Beginners
Clothing Beginners

courses.description:
This Course defines the different types of Fabrics and how to use them in developing a design, a group, or a collection. In this Course you learn fabric's Characteristics and Properties and Categories such as Knits, Woven and Non-Woven; analyzing fibers: Natural and Man-Made Fibers; Plant-based and Animal-based Fibers; and different types of Weaves.
This Course will not only educate you, but also inspire you to approach Fashion Designing from a different perspective: using fabrics as a source of inspiration to create your designs and develop a group or collection.
I will show you (by draping fabrics on a dress form), how different fabrics "react/behave".
This Course includes topics such as:
Fiber Content
Natura vs Man-made Fibers
Woven vs Knits
Different types of weaves: Oxford, Twill, Herringbone, Flannel, Popeline
Grainlines: Warp and Weft
Fabric Nap as in fabrics such as: Velvet, Corduroy, Velour, Velveteen
"Life" and Process of fabric: Greige Goods. Finishing Mills. Converters. Vertical Mills. Distributors. Jobbers.
Properties of Fabric: Weight, Drape, Construction, etc.
Sustainable and Organic fabrics for an eco-friendly environment.
How different Fabrics "behave": Chiffon, Canvas/Taffeta, Organza, Felt, Jersey.
Color and its importance in the context of fabric selection
Using Fabric as a Source of Inspiration in Designing
Choosing a Theme for your Collection: What is a Theme?
How to distress Denim (jeans); as well as creating a Tie-dye look
Fabric is one of the most important element in fashion designing and learning the different types of fabric is essential in creating a successful collection.
You will learn how to distress fabric (denim) to create a unique and individual fabric surface design. And you'll learn how to Tie-dye jeans.
You will see how designers use several layers of fabric to create a "new" fabric/look.
I will also include a great website regarding sustainable eco-friendly fabrics, where you can learn in-depth the environment and how the fashion industry effects its health;
I will include the name of a terrific Textbook that has swatches in it, so that you can actually "touch/feel" the fabric.
Choosing a Theme when starting a Fashion Collection is important in focusing on a design direction and establishing a cohesive group.
You will learn the importance of color when choosing fabric in designing a collection; the different "shades" of a color, known as "value", is something that every fashion designer must be familiar with and train the eye to recognize all the subtle difference in color hues.
If you have taken any of my other Fashion Design Courses, such as Sketching, Draping, Pattern Making, etc. this Fabric Course will add a new and important element to your proficiency in Fashion Designing.
Most professional fashion designers start with fabric: selecting and choosing the right fabric(s) for their collection. In most cases, fabric is the first step in designing a fashion collection.
Fabric and Textile: …2 words that are interchangeable, meaning I will be using them in place of each other (they have similar meaning).
You will see that the textile industry works way ahead of everybody else…. they know what you will be wearing 2-3 years from now….….they have to create new colors… new fibers, etc…
You will learn about FIBER Content … (what is) Fiber: is a filament, a thread, a thread-like piece, … and we’ll start by dividing Fibers into 2 categories: Natural Fibers… and… Man-Made Fibers
Starting with Natural Fibers… they also can be broken down into 2 categories: Plant based … and… Animal based Fibers.
We also have minor categories called Specialty Yarns or Novelty yarns, where the yarn is irregular… on purpose…, or have a unique quality to it… where the yarns might have loops in the middle of the yarn… etc...
You will learn that when the fabric has been woven or knitted, …that initial piece, that initial roll of fabric is known as GREIGE Goods……. it is RAW fabric so to speak.
You will learn the different qualities of fabric, such as: weight, drape, durability, softness, construction, breathability, and the "hand" of the fabric.
As fashion designers, we are all conscious and aware of our planet and its environmental issues. We have a moral obligation to protect the environment and promote sustainable development for future generations. Sustainable fabrics… and eco friendly fashion… what does this all mean? Why is this so important?  Because the type of fabric used to make a garment, will affect how much damage it causes on the environment.  When it comes to pollution, the fashion industry is one of the largest contributors in the world.
You will be educated in using eco-friendly fabrics that will not hurt the environment, and empower you to make a positive difference in the lives we live and ultimately making a difference in the health of our planet.
This course will inspire you to be a better designer and at the same time empower to be more conscious of the designing process.  You will learn to use the right fabrics for the right use. You will see, for example, how the use of leather (in the manufacturing process) is different from using fabric.
You will learn how to let fabric be a source of inspiration, by using fabric and through the process of draping, you can create a new design.
Fabric selection is a cornerstone of fashion design, playing a pivotal role in determining the outcome of a garment. The choice of fabric can elevate a design, imbuing it with texture, drape, and character.
Each fabric possesses unique properties that contribute to the overall look and feel of the piece. For instance, silk exudes luxury with its smooth, lustrous finish, while denim evokes a casual, rugged vibe with its sturdy weave.
Understanding the properties of different fabrics is essential for designers as it allows them to manipulate the material to achieve their desired aesthetic and functionality.
Factors such as weight, stretch, opacity, and breathability must be carefully considered to ensure that the fabric complements the design intent and enhances the wearer's experience.
Moreover, fabric selection can influence the garment's performance and longevity, impacting aspects like durability, ease of care, and comfort. In essence, fabrics are the building blocks of fashion design, serving as both the canvas and the medium through which designers bring their creative visions to life.
Sustainable fashion encompasses various practices aimed at reducing the environmental and social impacts of the fashion industry. It involves adopting strategies that promote longevity, ethical production, and mindful consumption.
Sustainability in the fashion industry refers to the integration of environmentally and socially responsible practices throughout the entire supply chain, from sourcing raw materials to manufacturing, distribution, and end-of-life disposal.
Sustainable design in fashion involves creating garments using materials and processes that minimize harm to the environment and prioritize fair labor practices. Examples of sustainable fashion include clothing made from organic or recycled materials, vintage or second-hand garments, and pieces designed for durability and multifunctionality.
Sustainable fashion collections are curated assortments of clothing lines that adhere to eco-friendly principles and ethical standards.
To be more sustainable in fashion, individuals and businesses can adopt practices such as reducing waste, choosing sustainable fabrics, embracing slow fashion, supporting ethical brands, and engaging in circular economy initiatives.
Sustainable fabrics are materials that have minimal environmental impact and are produced using processes that conserve resources and reduce pollution, such as organic cotton, hemp, bamboo, recycled polyester, and Tencel.
target_audience: Beginners and intermediate fashion designers.
Anyone who wants to learn about fabrics, whether you're a designer or a buyer or simply interested in learning a new area of the fashion industry.

courses.title: Beginners Sew Your Own Clothes Without Sewing Patterns

design a unique wardrobe of clothes

courses.description:
Create Your Own Clothing Collection is 4 fashionable, beginner friendly & easy to make pieces of clothing for suitable for complete beginners would not be appropriate for advanced seamstress If you want to sew your own clothes but are intimidated by using sewing patterns you will love using this course to make your own wardrobe without the use of any sewing patterns. the class begins with sewing techniques and tools need to succeed with this course. This Sew Your Own Fashion Collection course will help you become familiar with the basics of machine sewing, help you build your confidence at making your own clothes and develop sewing skills.
learn how to make your own fashion collection without the use of sewing patterns.  I have developed my own easy freehand cutting method this technique can be applied to anything you are making.
The course includes: Easy Freehand Cutting Method, Looking at Standard stitches Seaming curved edges Straight edges, standard seam and French seams on a home sewing machine. Beginners. You should have an interest and a desire to learn but no previous experience is required. No need for intimidating sewing patterns
